definition: to float/to drift
variant of 飄|飘[piao1]
to float
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The flag was flapping about in the light wind.
sentences.chinese: 那面旗子在微风中飘动。

sentences.english: Long flowing locks, but his face and body hairless.
sentences.chinese: 一缕缕飘动的长发，但是脸部和身体却没有毛发。

sentences.english: A cloak of raven feathers fluttered from his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 渡鸦羽毛的斗篷在肩头上顺风飘动。

sentences.english: Fenbo Department of the waves, in the face of the expressions solidification.
sentences.chinese: 长发和脖颈处的粉白纱巾飘动着，脸上的表情凝固着。

sentences.english: The red flags were riffled by the breeze.

sentences.chinese: 丝带飘动着，小巧的布鞋。

sentences.english: Our Five-Starred Red Flag is riffling in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 我们的五星红旗在微风中飘动。

sentences.english: The leaves drift in the storm.
She twirls around to show how the skirt moves.
sentences.chinese: 她旋转身躯来显示裙子如何飘动。

sentences.english: A small flag fluttered in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 一面小旗在微风中飘动。

sentences.english: The flags were dancing in the breeze.
Her topsails and flying kites had a faint glow upon them where the dawn caught them.
sentences.chinese: 上桅帆和迎风飘动的轻帆映着晨曦的微光。

sentences.english: Her hair ripples in the spring breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在春风中像波浪般飘动。

sentences.english: The flag was flapping about in the wind.
Hair and neck scarf Fenbo Department of the waves, in the face of the expressions solidification.
sentences.chinese: 长发和脖颈处的粉白纱巾飘动着，脸上的表情凝固着。

sentences.english: "This shear layer flaps and up and down like a flag in the wind, " Rowley said.
sentences.chinese: 这一剪切层像风中的旗帜一样上下飘动。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to drift lightly
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
to brush/to caress (of breeze)/to praise
appearing and disappearing (idiom)/intermittently visible
to wave/to flutter/to fly
wind-borne/tossed about by the wind
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to waft (through the air)/to drift
to curl up/to linger on (sound)
to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
